Scenárista Avengers: Endgame vysvetľuje, prečo pri Captainovi America zmenili pravidlá používania Mjolniru
04 Nov 2019, 09:24 by Dominik Vetrák

Captain America s Mjolnirom dokázal niečo, čo nám predošlý film vyvrátil.

Scenáristi Avengers: Endgame sa po premiére vyjadrovali k množstvu udalostí vo filme. Až teraz sa však jeden zo scenáristov, konkrétne Christopher Markus, rozhovoril o Mjolnire a o tom, ako ho využil Captain America.
Ten s ním počas súboja s Thanosom dokázal privolať blesky. Scéna bola sama o seba doslova epická. Čakali sme na ňu už od prvého filmu Avengers a keď sa to konečne stalo, málokomu zrejme napadlo, že si tvorovia odporujú. 
V Thor: Ragnarok nám (a hlavne Thorovi) Odin prezradil, že privolávať blesky nikdy nebola schopnosť Mjolniru. Stále to robil Thor, pričom kladivo slúžilo ako usmerňovač Thorovej sily. Markus konkrétne spomína na to, že o tom viedli debaty. Keďže v Ragnaroku zaviedli isté pravidlo, mali by ho aj dodržiavať. Celá scéna im ale prišla natoľko úžasná, že sa rozhodli ohnúť svoje pravidlá a nechať Capa privolať blesky, hoci by to v skutočnosti nemal nijako dokázať. 




ĎALŠIE ČLÁNKY, KTORÉ BY ŤA MOHLI ZAUJÍMAŤ

Avengers: Endgame explains why Captain America changed the rules for using Mjolnir
04 Nov 2019, 09:24 by Dominik Vetrak

Captain America and Mjolnir did something that the previous film disproved.

After the premiere, Avengers: Endgame screenwriters commented on a number of events in the film. But only now one of the screenwriters, namely Christopher Markus, has talked about Mjolnire and how Captain America used it.
He was able to call him lightning during a duel with Thanos. The scene was literally epic in itself. We've been waiting for her since the first Avengers movie, and when it finally happened, few seemed to think the creatures were contradictory.
In Thor: Ragnarok Odin (and especially Thor) told us that calling lightning was never the ability of Mjolnir. Thor was still doing this, and the hammer served as a rectifier of Thor's power. In particular, Markus recalls that they have been debating this. Since they introduced a rule in Ragnarok, they should also follow it. But the whole scene seemed so amazing to them that they decided to bend their rules and let Capo summon lightning, although he really shouldn't do it.
